title: How to Make a Dessert Taco

steps.headline: Place 4 pizza rolls on the soft taco shell.
Cook in your microwave for 1-5 minutes on high.
Pull it out and place some strawberries on the pizza rolls.
Use filling amounts appropriate for the number of tacos you'll be making.
steps.description: This has been left open purposefully, so judge using your cooking intuition.

steps.headline: Add Nutella to a double boiler.
steps.description: Heat over medium heat to melt. Alternatively, zap in the microwave.

steps.headline: Dip the edges of the taco shells in the melted Nutella.
steps.description: Cover a small way down the edges, not too much. Lay on a parchment covered baking sheet.

steps.headline: Place the Nutella-dipped tacos into the freezer.
steps.description: Freeze for 15 to 20 minutes, or until set.

steps.headline: Cut the fruit while the tacos are setting.
steps.description: Hull and halve the strawberries and peel and slice the kiwifruit.

steps.headline: Remove the tacos from the freezer.
steps.description: Fill each shell with the vanilla pudding. You can vary the pudding flavor as preferred.

steps.headline: Add fruit pieces to each taco.
steps.description: Pipe or spoon whipped cream across the top of the fruit.

steps.headline: Sprinkle with powdered sugar for garnish.
steps.description: Although optional, it adds a tasty and fancy touch.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Arrange on serving plates and offer as dessert.

steps.headline: Use filling amounts appropriate for the number of tacos you'll be making.
steps.description: This has been left open purposefully, so judge using your cooking intuition.

steps.headline: Arrange the tacos on a flat working surface.
Fill each taco with chocolate pudding.
Cut the banana into slices.
steps.description: Add the slices to each taco, on top of the chocolate pudding.

steps.headline: Pour chocolate sauce over the bananas.
steps.description: This can be ice cream syrup or the chocolate topping that hardens when poured.

steps.headline: Sprinkle shredded coconut over the top.
steps.description: The dessert tacos are now ready for serving.

text: Pizza roll dessert taco Place 4 pizza rolls on the soft taco shell.  Cook in your microwave for 1-5 minutes on high.  Pull it out and place some strawberries on the pizza rolls.  Spray on some whipped cream.  Nutella and fruit dessert tacos Use filling amounts appropriate for the number of tacos you'll be making. This has been left open purposefully, so judge using your cooking intuition. Add Nutella to a double boiler. Heat over medium heat to melt. Alternatively, zap in the microwave. Dip the edges of the taco shells in the melted Nutella. Cover a small way down the edges, not too much. Lay on a parchment covered baking sheet. Place the Nutella-dipped tacos into the freezer. Freeze for 15 to 20 minutes, or until set. Cut the fruit while the tacos are setting. Hull and halve the strawberries and peel and slice the kiwifruit. Remove the tacos from the freezer. Fill each shell with the vanilla pudding. You can vary the pudding flavor as preferred. Add fruit pieces to each taco. Pipe or spoon whipped cream across the top of the fruit. Sprinkle with powdered sugar for garnish. Although optional, it adds a tasty and fancy touch. Serve. Arrange on serving plates and offer as dessert. Chocolate banana dessert tacos Use filling amounts appropriate for the number of tacos you'll be making. This has been left open purposefully, so judge using your cooking intuition. Arrange the tacos on a flat working surface.  Fill each taco with chocolate pudding.  Cut the banana into slices. Add the slices to each taco, on top of the chocolate pudding. Pour chocolate sauce over the bananas. This can be ice cream syrup or the chocolate topping that hardens when poured. Sprinkle shredded coconut over the top. The dessert tacos are now ready for serving.
